column5: I would agree that there is limited tackle since Kevin and Andrea left (K&A), but like most other shopping experiences in Dryden you need to go to 10 different stores to get what you need.
Canadian Tire has a pretty good tackle section. Taking a drive to Vermilion Bay and checking out Bobby's is still your best bet. Bring your wallet....
Bobby's does have a great selection(especially if you r into muskie).kinda miss the grumpy old fella that used to be there. definitly entertaining(even when i got berated).
I can see it now, the new IGA/Cabelas store.
Hi Men... Need to overnite in Dryden in Mid July. Already have motel reservations. However, I would like some tips for where to shop for booze, bait, groceries, etc... Thanks ahead, Jimi
We have often shopped at Extra Foods, on the East edge of Dryden. I think Beer must be purchased at the government run Beer Store, sorry I don't have the address
Safeway, Booze and Beer store is around the corner. Matt

beer store is on queen street(runs along train tracks,south side.bait can be had at qsl tackle(can see it from the beer store).liquor store is at the other end of the block from qsl and u will probly pass a grocery store comin into town(safeway if u come from I falls).just past first set of lights
There is even a goodsized Walmart on the east side of town!!!!!!!!!!!
K&A tackle is the best for bait, its on Government St. next to 7/11.
Is paper mill still functional in Dryden ??? If so, I would advise not to stay down the wind from it ..
would agree they r the best for bait. but thats it.can't get a license.no tackle.p%#s poor for a bait shop

Just a heads up. You may want to check the hours of operation of the BEER store. I know we have run into issues in the past. They have very limited hours of operation. IN addition when I went up last year it was like the first Monday of the month or something and was a holiday so all the gov't places were closed.
The town could use a good sporting goods/bait shop (especially since Tony's closed), not sure with the short summer season one could make a go of it though.
